title: RouteRecs
description: While I was on a roadtrip from Vancouver to Joffre Lakes, I found it inconvenient to find gas stations or attractions en route. I worked on creating a mobile app that suggests points of interest from point A to B without having to cancel the route.

title: Portfolio
description: I designed and built a website to list my credentials and projects in an aesthetic frame. I sculpted a design based on research, UI/UX design principles and my personal tastes on Figma. Then I transferred that design to React and CSS, making sure to evolve the design based on the necessary configurations in the code.

title: Echoes of the Past
description: In 2023, I created a desktop application during my first hackathon called NWHacks. Our group of four team members developed a desktop app displaying heritage sites around Vancouver to encourage people to go sightseeing in their local area post-pandemic. This was also my first foray into React development.

title: Pantry Planner
description: A hackathon project of a website aimed to reduce food waste. The application suggests recipes based on the user's available ingredients. Our tech stack consists of a React frontend and Flask backend. User accounts and recipes are stored on a MongoDB database and connected with RESTful APIs.

title: D&D Spellbook
description: I have a passion for Dungeons & Dragons and I noticed that the spellcasters in my campaign found it difficult to keep track of their spells. For this reason, I created a web app that stores and displays spells for each character. I serialized JSON spell data into an SQLite database using efficient queries, making sure to exclude extraneous sections.

title: Movie Watchlist
description: Desktop app listing and saving shows and movies a user has watched in the past and present
